meanings.definition: Relating to the earth or its inhabitants.
meanings.sent1: The eathly creatures roamed the forest, blending in with the natural surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The soil felt eathly beneath my feet as I walked through the garden.
meanings.sent3: The eathly rabbits played hide and seek among the bushes, their fur camouflaged against the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her connection to the eathly elements was so strong, she could feel the earth's heartbeat beneath her.
meanings.sent5: The eathly scent of fresh rain on the soil filled the air, reminding me of the earth's vitality.

meanings.definition: In a way that is characteristic of the earth or its qualities.
meanings.sent1: She moved eathly through the forest, her steps light and sure on the leaf-covered ground.
meanings.sent2: The artist's paintings captured the eathly tones of the landscape, bringing nature to life on canvas.
meanings.sent3: The eathly music of the wind rustling through the trees created a soothing melody in the woods.
meanings.sent4: His voice resonated eathly in the cavern, echoing off the stone walls with a deep, earthy timbre.
meanings.sent5: The eathly rhythm of the river flowing over rocks was a calming presence in the valley.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the physical world as opposed to the spiritual realm.
meanings.sent1: Her eathly concerns focused on practical matters like food, shelter, and safety.
meanings.sent2: The eathly pleasures of a warm fire and good company were all he needed to feel content.
meanings.sent3: In the eathly realm of business, he was a savvy negotiator, always seeking the best deal.
meanings.sent4: The eathly realm of science explored the mysteries of the natural world through observation and experimentation.
meanings.sent5: His eathly ambitions drove him to succeed in the material world, seeking wealth and status above all else.
